reviews.text: This hotel is best described as quirky. Its in a lovely square where a flea market is held every morning, so lots going on. The hotel lobby looks a bit down at heel, and their admin leaves a little to be desired. I was staying here as part of a group attending a conference and the hotel was booked for us. I arrived with a visually impaired colleague and his guide dog, the reception staff were very helpful, but told us they were overbooked and that some of our group would have to share - reading other reviews it seems that overbooking is a problem here. However, my colleague and I were the first to arrive and were able to get single rooms. There were also two other people at reception having the same problem when we arrived, so make sure you check that they actually have a room for you
reviews.title: Okay rooms, great friendly staff and quirky with a swimming pool (next door!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has free wifi, which I appreciated had no problem connecting to - though the connection did drop out a couple of times and the signal could have been stronger.
reviews.title: Smack in the heart of the old Marolles, Brussels

reviews.text: The lift here doesnt work (and looks like it hasnt worked in years) so I would strongly advise anyone with mobility problems to check if the lift works before booking. Fortunately my colleague carried my v heavy suitcase up the stairs (my room was on the second floor). My room itself was fine if very small, however, it was clean, and the bathroom, again small but perfectly useable and clean. The toilet itself is in a very strange little alcove in the bathroom, odd.
reviews.title: fine

reviews.text: There was very little storage space in the room and enough room to hang about three items of clothing, and just enough room on the desk for my laptop. The room was nicely decorated and had lovely windows which opened (always a plus) however my room was at the back of the hotel, and was very badly overlooked by another building. I prefer to sleep with the curtains open which simply wouldnt be possible here as the other building was so close, it also makes the room quite dark. There was also no full length (or even half length mirror and that needs to be rectified, although the room was small, a mirror could have been fixed to the door.
reviews.title: Very friendly staff, excellent breakfast and cosy warm rooms

reviews.text: this little hotel opens its windows on a very beautiful square, "place de jeu de balle" and on the legendary flea market. we asked for a 4 people room, and we had a lovely, very well furnished double-chambre, for the children with a bunk bed, and for us with a queen size bed. we had nice bathroom with shower and all furniture was chosen with elegance and was very classy. the hotel is very very quiet, altought it was full we never heard a noise during the 2 nights staying. moreover they cleaned very well the room, and this is a plus.
reviews.title: really nice and suitable for families!
Bad business
reviews.text: Breakfast is very abundant and it is served in a very very nice room, with the tipical atmosphere of a brasserie. Coffee, milk, tea and also cappuccino and expresso are available. the orange juice is maybe the only thing I did not like, it is was only some water and orange-juice powder, BUT, the "terrine" ( a kind of pate' ) was wonderful and fresh home-made, the croissants were really super and there was agood choice of jams and butter and honey and a large choice of cold cuts ( ham, salami...) and a good camerbert too. Price was really honest, moreover in a city like Bruxelles and during first May vacations. Absolutely recommended!

Booked the hotel through booking.com, was informed of the overbooking by the booking.com, canceled a week before arrival through the booking agency, received conformation of 0 Euro charge. Stayed with friends in Brussels instead. After coming back home received a statement from Visa card, informing me that I was charged by the Hotel Galia for 1 night stay. That just made me and my husband another victim to the hotel's bad business attitude (see previous reviews complaining of overbooking and being charged for it).
reviews.title: Good value, good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here just after Easter when it is generally busy everywhere. Room was small but just redecorated and clean. Double glazing and cold nights with windows closed meant that noise from flee market preparations each morning didn't disturb us....might be different in warmer weather! Staff were obliging and breakfasts good. (continental) restaurant Chez Nous good fresh local cuisine. We'd come again.
reviews.title: The hotel Galia, not for all tastes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I were looking for a cheap European getaway and saw a deal on Eurostar, £59 return travel to Brussels. With this in mind we would need somewhere to stay and so I set my partner the task of finding a hotel with a small budget.
reviews.title: Good price, great breakfast

reviews.text: The hotel is very clean and tidy, our room was fresh renovated and has new furniture. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel is located near Brussels Midi railway station, in the centre of Brussels. So you need just 10 minutes to walk to the famous Manneken Pis :) The breakfast was fresh and tasty! Everything was perfect!
reviews.title: Very, very good! Clean, comfortable, centre of Brussels
for 1 night is ok
reviews.text: I stayed there 1 night, i went there to follow a dj playing , and was perfect cause is situated 5 minutes to the famous Fuse Club. About the hotel i can say my room was ok, only thing the bathroom was really small,like a camper's one..about position, the hotel is well located ,10 minutes by walk from Grand Place..and in front of the hotel there's a strange market and a good restaurant , but i forget the name..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Made a reservation through the hotel website a month in advance, announced the expected time of arrival, however upon our arrival we were told they did not have a room for us, much to our surprise and dismay. No excuse and in a very indifferent manner. We got a taxi to another hotel; the receptionist did not pay him enough for the drive so we had to pay extra and had to go back the next day to get our money back, once again in a very indifferent manner, with lots of sighing and eye rolls. The other hotel was very good luckily, would recommend that one (Les Bluets) definitely.
reviews.title: Overbooked, overall poor service, not recommendable

reviews.text: Spacious, comfortable rooms, friendly, smily and helpful staff. Average breakfast, served in a relaxed and homey breakfast room - this homey feeling is everywhere and is reassuring and comforting. The flea market is fun and I've still got my lovely wine glasses from there... Inviting and relaxed bars just outside the hotel... Very good location and a nice walk to the centre of town. Excellent value for money, recommended any time!
reviews.title: Charming, welcoming and cosy
Old but comfortable and charming
reviews.text: Upon our arrival we were greeted at reception by the lovely, and very French, Marion who made the 3 of us us feel welcome.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm a very opened minded traveller and tend not to read too much into bad reviews as someone's palace is someone's prison cell. This is why I booked the Hotel Galia.
reviews.title: Always open minded but this was bad!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a very easy hotel to find thanks to Google Map however it is, as stated in reviews, in front of a flea market which seems to be on every day and in what I would call a bit of a dodgy area.
reviews.title: Cosy hotel with personal flair

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival at the hotel, myself and my partner were given room 52. You get the lift to floor 3 and walk the rest. It can only be described as a bad loft conversion. Booking a double room meant you got 2 single beds with a massive loft window above one of the beds, a terrible bathroom and nowhere to hang your clothes. After speaking to the receptionist we were given room 34. A slight improvement with a double bed but still not worth the 85 euros paid.
reviews.title: Dodgy area and Double Booked!

reviews.text: Once out of the hotel and on the main road, you are taken to a completely different area and the lovely part of Brussels. It was only a 5 minute walk so that's a positive.
reviews.title: The greatest hotel of the entire trip!

reviews.text: We were awakened at 4am with the delivery man who seemed to be going for guinness record in the loudest person talking on his mobile phone! Then the set up of the flea market started. There was no air conditioning but even with the window closed you could here everything. Needless to say a good sleep was not had.
reviews.title: Cheating hotel that double charged me and refused to refund
